Analisa Mengapa Bunga Kredit Perbankan Sulit Turun
07 Nov 2019, 20:03 by Magdalena


Analisa Mengapa Bunga Kredit Perbankan Sulit Turun

KBRN, Jakarta:  Ekonom senior Anton Gunawan mengatakan dalam mencermati perkembangan suku bunga perbankan,  jangan melihat kondisi saat ini saja ketika terjadi kecenderungan suku bunga bank sentral menurun.Anton mengungkapkan hal tersebut, merespon desakan Presiden Joko Widodo agar perbankan segera menurunkan suku bunga kreditnya, menyusul penurunan suka bunga BI yang sudah dilakukan sebanyak empat kali sepanjang tahun ini."Kita juga harus lihat dari proses perkembangan suku bunga sebelumnya. pada waktu suku bunga naik di tahun 2018 dengan cukup lumayan, bank pun tidak menaikkan suku bunga kreditnya dengan cepat,  untuk menjaga jangan sampai terjadi kegagalan bayar, dan supaya pertumbuhan kreditnya terjaga, apalagi ketika itu pertumbuhan kreditnya melambat," jelas Anton, Kamis (7/11/2019).Dalam perspektif jangka panjang, sambung Anton,  ada suatu periode dimana tingkat suku bunga dioertahankan agar relatif lebih stabil dengan berbagai macam pertimbangan, guna mempertahankan bisnis bank bersangkutan. Tapi dari sisi suku bunga dana, responnya bisa lebih cepat. Bagi bank yang memang cukup banyak likuiditasnya, jelas Anton, akan lebih mudah menurunkan suku bunganya. Misalnya suku bunga special rate deposit, akan turun ketika suku bunga cenderung turun."Likuiditas, ini faktor yang perlu dipertimbangkan kalau melihat siklusnya, walaupun memang secara keseluruhan suku bunga kita secara riil masih cukup tinggi. Bahkan dalam policy rate sendiri dibandingkan dengan ekspektasi inflasi yang masih 3 persen, itu masih dikisaran 1,75  hingga 2 persen,  riil interest ratenya masih tinggi , bahkan tadinya suku bunga kredit 2,5 sampai  3 persen.  Ini yang mesti nantinya berangsur angsur ditekan sejalan dengan inflasi yang turun, maka suku bunga lain akan ikut turun," papar Anton.Tapi faktor lain yang perlu dipertimbangkan adalah perkembangan dari bisnis perbankan dan bisnis dari pengusahanya sendiri. Pada saat tertentu, ketika permintaan kredit  mulai kencang lagi, tukas Anton,  kalau likuiditasnya cukup, perbankan juga akan mencoba menurunkan tingkat suku bunganya."Yang dilakukan bank sekarang adalah seberapa jauh mereka melakukan efisiensinya, dengan harapan cost of fundnya akan turun, sehingga bisa menurunkan dari sisi suku bunga kreditnya. sementara net interest margin yang sempat di angka 6 persen, sekarang sudah turun dibawah 5 persen. Ini mencerminkan adanya efisiensi,   tapi masih cukup tinggi dibandingkan negara lain, karena masih ada biaya lain yang cukup tinggi dalam sektor perbankan kita. Jadi ok saja kalau bank memang mau menurunkan, tapi mereka harus memperhitungkan kelanjutan bisnisnya dan kemampuanny melakukan efisiensi," tandas Anton.

Analysis of Why Bank Credit Interest Difficult to Decline
Nov 7 2019, 20:03 by Magdalena


Analysis of Why Bank Credit Interest Difficult to Decline

KBRN, Jakarta: Senior economist Anton Gunawan said that in observing the development of bank interest rates, do not look at the current conditions when the central bank's interest rates are declining. BI's interest rate reduction has been carried out four times so far this year. "We also have to look at the process of the development of interest rates before. When interest rates rise in 2018 fairly well, banks will not raise their lending rates quickly, to keep don't fail to pay, and so that credit growth is maintained, especially when credit growth is slowing down, "Anton explained, Thursday (11/07/2019). In a long-term perspective, continued Anton, there was a period in which interest rates were maintained to be relatively more stable with a variety of considerations, in order to maintain business the bank concerned. But in terms of funding interest rates, the response can be faster. For banks with a lot of liquidity, Anton explained, it would be easier to reduce interest rates. For example, the special deposit rate will go down when interest rates tend to fall. "Liquidity, this is a factor that needs to be considered when looking at the cycle, even though our overall interest rates are actually quite high in real terms. Even in the policy rate itself compared to inflation expectations still at 3 percent, it is still around 1.75 to 2 percent, the real interest rate is still high, even the credit interest rate was 2.5 to 3 percent This is what must be gradually reduced in line with falling inflation, then other interest rates will come down, "said Anton. But another factor to consider is the development of the banking business and the business of the entrepreneurs themselves. At a certain time, when credit demand starts to tighten again, said Anton, if the liquidity is sufficient, banks will also try to reduce the interest rate. "What banks are doing now is how far they are doing their efficiency, in the hope that the cost of funds will drop, so that it can reduce In terms of lending rates, while the net interest margin, which was at 6 percent, has now fallen below 5 percent, this reflects an efficiency, but it is still quite high compared to other countries, because there are still quite high costs in our banking sector. So it's OK if the banks really want to reduce, but they have to take into account the continuity of their business and their ability to do efficiency, "said Anton.
